hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus: Abu Shahab narrated to us from al-Hasan ibn Amr: Farqad al-Sabakhi saw with Ibrahim a man whose buttons were undone and a man whose hair was braided. Farqad said: O Abu Imran, why don't you forbid this one from undoing his buttons and this one from braiding his hair? Abraham said: I don't know if the stupidity of the tribe of Asad has overcome you or the thickness of the tribe of Tamim. As for this one, he found the heat and undid his buttons, and as for this one, he lets his hair down when he wants to pray, God willing.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Hasan ibn Amr: Farqad said: O Abu Imran, I woke up worried about my obligation which is six dirhams, and the month had begun but I did not have them. So I prayed. While I was walking on the bank of the Euphrates, I saw six dirhams. I took them and weighed them, and they were exactly six, no more and no less. He said: Give them in charity, for they are not yours.
